instruction: The school uses distance education for clinical training involving live model procedures.
response: Non-compliant. Distance education cannot be used for clinical instruction involving live models or clients. (Requirement 1)

instruction: The school's distance education includes direct instruction and provides feedback on student work.
response: Compliant. Substantive interaction requires at least two elements, such as direct instruction and feedback. (Requirement 2a)

instruction: Students watch prerecorded videos and complete assignments without interacting with instructors.
response: Non-compliant. Distance education must include substantive and regular interaction between students and instructors. (Requirement 2)

instruction: Instructors schedule weekly Q&A sessions and provide regular discussion forums.
response: Compliant. These are forms of regular and substantive interaction required for distance education. (Requirements 2a, 2b)

instruction: The institution tracks student login times but does not assess engagement or interaction.
response: Non-compliant. Instructors must monitor academic engagement and ensure substantive interaction. (Requirement 2b.ii)

instruction: The program is clock-hour based and uses asynchronous distance education without validating seat time.
response: Non-compliant. Asynchronous instruction in clock hour programs must be validated for actual seat time. (Requirement 2c)

instruction: Each distance education student is assessed in-person monthly by a qualified instructor.
response: Compliant. Institutions must conduct monthly on-campus assessments of distance education performance. (Requirement 3)

instruction: The school only assesses distance education students online without bringing them to campus.
response: Non-compliant. A qualified instructor must assess students in person on campus at least once monthly. (Requirement 3)

instruction: After completing all program requirements, a student takes both final written and practical exams on campus.
response: Compliant. A comprehensive academic and practical final exam must be administered on-campus. (Requirement 4)

instruction: The school conducts final exams online for convenience.
response: Non-compliant. Final exams must be administered on-campus. (Requirement 4)

instruction: A student's transcript notes the portions of the program completed through distance education.
response: Compliant. All transcripts or documents must identify the distance education component. (Requirement 5)

instruction: The student's academic transcript does not mention any distance education.
response: Non-compliant. Transcripts must indicate distance education components. (Requirement 5)

instruction: Students sign a form during enrollment acknowledging that distance education may not be accepted in all states.
response: Compliant. A signed and dated disclaimer must be provided and kept in the student file. (Requirement 6)

instruction: The school verbally informs students about distance education limitations without documentation.
response: Non-compliant. The disclaimer must be signed, dated, and maintained in the student's file. (Requirement 6)

instruction: Instructors provide direct feedback on weekly student submissions and respond to content questions.
response: Compliant. This satisfies the requirement for substantive interaction. (Requirement 2a.ii & 2a.iii)

instruction: No live discussion or scheduled interaction is provided in the distance education program.
response: Non-compliant. There must be scheduled opportunities for interaction and ongoing monitoring by instructors. (Requirement 2b)

instruction: Distance education courses are delivered asynchronously but include verified seat time calculations for compliance.
response: Compliant. Asynchronous delivery must be validated for actual student seat time. (Requirement 2c)

instruction: Students in distance education have not been assessed on-campus in over two months.
response: Non-compliant. A monthly on-campus assessment by a qualified instructor is required. (Requirement 3)

instruction: The school uses recorded lectures and automatically graded quizzes but does not meet with students.
response: Non-compliant. Substantive interaction is not optionalâ€”must include active engagement between student and instructor. (Requirement 2)

instruction: The institution complies with local, state, and federal regulations and incorporates NACCAS interaction standards.
response: Compliant. Distance education policies must meet all applicable legal and NACCAS requirements. (Intro paragraph)
